node.title: PETSc was configured with MPICH but now appears to be compiling using a non-MPICH mpi.h
node.bodyText:
Hi,
When I ran "make -j 6" for test after installed MOOSE following the Build and Test MOOSE, I got 2 problems as below:
/public/home/ghfund3_a47/mambaforge3/envs/moose/include/petscsys.h:235:6: error: #error "PETSc was configured with MPICH but now appears to be compiling using a non-MPICH mpi.h"`
`/opt/rh/devtoolset-7/root/usr/include/c++/7/bits/stl_algobase.h:378:57: error: no type named 'value_type' in 'struct std::iterator_traits<infix_ostream_iterator<std::basic_string<char> > >'`

What should I do to fix them?
Thank you  for your help!

Hello
for the first one it seems you are mixing mpi distributions. Can you paste the output of the diagnostics script in moose/scripts? So we can check how the mixing is happening
Guillaume

Hi GiudGiud,
The output after ran diagnostics.sh as below:

_=/usr/bin/env

You have mamba and a local MPI compiler loaded.
I think you are on a HPC machine so you should not use mamba. You should be following our HPC instructions

You are right!
I tried again following HPC Cluster, when I was runing 'update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh' got below report:
INFO: Checking for HDF5...
INFO: HDF5 library not detected, opting to download via PETSc...
python3: can't open file '/public/home/ghfund3_a47/projects/moose-next/petsc/./configure': [Errno 2] No such file or directory
There was an error. Exiting...

It seems without HDF5 on the HPC, but I haven't permission to install HDF5.
Any other ways can I use to install MOOSE?

If you have write access to your home directory, and access to the internet from that account: then you have permission to install everything you need.
The error in question may stem from an earlier error. Perhaps failing to download HDF5? The modules I am seeing loaded, as well as the version of GCC in use, is below the minimum version we require (MOOSE requires GCC 7.5.0 or newer). So you will need to take care of that before continuing (PETSc may build fine, then libMesh... but then MOOSE will fail, wasting your time!).
It's most likely that you have newer versions or GCC available via modules. My advice is to run: module avail, peruse over that list, and choose modules which satisfy MOOSE's requirements. They need to fall into:


Python: >=3.8 <3.11

3.10.x being the stable standard at the moment.



GCC >= 7.5.0 < 11.x

Try to stick with a version in between the range above. It's safer to stay away from bleeding edge compilers. Most of our testing is done on GCC 8.x - 10.x.
Intel compilers are not supported.



MPI

This can be OpenMPI, MPICH, MVAPICH. You'll likely see all three available on your cluster. However, it may be best to ask your HPC admins which MPI stack to use. Clusters are usually tailor made, and therefor have a very optimized MPI stack. This is why we ask users to avoid using our Conda packages, when operating on an HPC cluster.



Basically, I am asking you to remove Conda from the equation, and start over, by figuring out what "modules" are available on your cluster.

node.title: Element Integral Variable user object
node.bodyText:
Hello everybody
I wanted to ask a question about a detail I don't understand in the implementation of the Element Integral / Element Integral Variable user object.
The virtual Real getValue(); method in the Element Integral user object is meant to provide the value of the postprocessor for external use, if I understand correctly.
However, if I try to do something like:
_uo(getUserObject<ElementIntegralVariableUserObject>("user_object")),
to retrieve the user object, and then call uo.getValue(), for instance in some method of the class I'm working on, I get an error of the type:
passing 'const ElementIntegralVariableUserObject' as 'this' argument discards qualifiers [-fpermissive]
This , to my understanding, is due to the fact that getValue() is not a constant method, therefore it cannot be called on a constant reference like the one returned by getUserObject.
My question is then, why is getValue() not a constant method?
I see for instance that the public return methods of LayeredBase are constant:
 virtual Real integralValue(Point p) const;

  /**
   * Get the value for a given layer
   * @param layer The layer index
   * @return The value for the given layer
   */
  virtual Real getLayerValue(unsigned int layer) const;

  /**
   * Helper function to return the layer the point lies in.
   * @param p The point.
   * @return The layer the Point is found in.
   */
  virtual unsigned int getLayer(Point p) const;

and the same is true for NearestPointBase
/**
  * Given a Point return the integral value associated with the layer
  * that point falls in for the layered average closest to that
  * point.
  *
  * @param p The point to look for in the layers.
  */
 virtual Real spatialValue(const Point & p) const override;

 /**
  * Get the points at which the nearest operation is performed
  * @return points
  */
 virtual const std::vector<Point> & getPoints() const { return _points; }


And InterfaceQpUserobjectBase

  /**
   * method returning the quadrature point value
   **/
  Real getQpValue(const dof_id_type elem, const unsigned int side, unsigned int qp) const;
  /**
   * function returning the element side average value
   **/
  Real getSideAverageValue(const dof_id_type elem, const unsigned int side) const;

and really just about any user object I see.
Am I misunderstanding how I should retrieve the value of the Element Integral Variable user object?
Thanks in advance

Hello
we have an ongoing maintenance task to make this routine const.
It was not because it used to be performing réduction across processes but that got cleared recently
For now you ll want to const cast away the constness to be able to use getValue
Guillaume
Thank you!

node.title: "add_output" is not a registered task
node.bodyText:
I have moose installed using python on an HPC cluster.  Moose works when just running directly on a node, but I'm having trouble getting it to run with sbatch.  The .slurm file is:
#!/bin/bash
#SBATCH --job-name=MOOSE1
#SBATCH --account=elbert
#SBATCH --partition=compute-hugemem
#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=40
#SBATCH --mem=700G
#SBATCH --time=24:00:00 # Max runtime in DD-HH:MM:SS format.
#SBATCH --chdir=/gscratch/elbert/projects/cahn_hilliard2
#SBATCH --export=ALL

mamba init
source ~/.bashrc
mamba activate moose
mpiexec -np 38 ./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i

This leads to an error that I can't track down:
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/bin/conda
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/bin/conda-env
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/bin/activate
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/bin/deactivate
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/conda.sh
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/etc/fish/conf.d/conda.fish
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/shell/condabin/Conda.psm1
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/shell/condabin/conda-hook.ps1
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/xontrib/conda.xsh
no change     /mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/etc/profile.d/conda.csh
modified      /mmfs1/home/elbertdl/.bashrc

==> For changes to take effect, close and re-open your current shell. <==

Added mamba to /mmfs1/home/elbertdl/.bashrc

==> For changes to take effect, close and re-open your current shell. <==



*** ERROR ***
"add_output" is not a registered task.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0```
This is an input problem. Can you please share your input file?
Separate problem - but there is not a need to call mamba init more than once.

#
# Example simulation of an iron-chromium alloy at 500 C. Equilibrium
# concentrations are at 23.6 and 82.3 mol% Cr. Kappa value, free energy equation,
# and mobility equation were provided by Lars Hoglund. Solved using the split
# form of the Cahn-Hilliard equation.
#

[Mesh]
  type = GeneratedMesh
  dim = 2
  elem_type = QUAD4
  nx = 128
  ny = 128
  nz = 0
  xmin = 0
  xmax = 1
  ymin = 0
  ymax = 1
  zmin = 0
  zmax = 0
  uniform_refine = 2
[]

[Variables]
  [./c]   # Mole fraction of Cr (unitless)
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
  [./w]   # Chemical potential (eV/mol)
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
[]

[Variables]
  [./c]   # Mole fraction of Cr (unitless)
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
  [./w]   # Chemical potential (eV/mol)
    order = FIRST
    family = LAGRANGE
  [../]
[]

[ICs]
  [./concentrationIC]   # 46.774 mol% Cr with variations
    type = CrossIC
    variable = c
    x1 = 0.25
    x2 = 0.75
    y1 = 0.25
    y2 = 0.75
    average = 0.45
    amplitude = 0.4
  [../]
[]

[BCs]
  [./Periodic]
    [./c_bcs]
      auto_direction = 'x y'
    [../]
  [../]
[]

[Kernels]
  [./w_dot]
    variable = w
    v = c
    type = CoupledTimeDerivative
  [../]
  [./coupled_res]
    variable = w
    type = SplitCHWRes
    mob_name = M
  [../]
  [./coupled_parsed]
    variable = c
    type = SplitCHParsed
    f_name = f_loc
    kappa_name = kappa_c
    w = w
  [../]
[]

[Materials]
  # d is a scaling factor that makes it easier for the solution to converge
  # without changing the results. It is defined in each of the first three
  # materials and must have the same value in each one.
  [./constants]
    # Define constant values kappa_c and M. Eventually M will be replaced with
    # an equation rather than a constant.
    type = GenericFunctionMaterial
    prop_names = 'kappa_c'
    prop_values = '0.1'
                   # kappa_c*eV_J*nm_m^2*d

  [../]
 [./mobility]               # Mobility (nm^2 mol/eV/s)
    # NOTE: This is a fitted equation, so only 'Conv' has units
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    property_name = M
    coupled_variables = c
    constant_names =       'Acr nm_m   eV_J   d'
    constant_expressions = '1.0  1e+09      6.24150934e+18          1e-27'
    expression = 'Acr*c*(1-c)'
    derivative_order = 1
    outputs = exodus
  [../]
  [./local_energy]           # Local free energy function (eV/mol)
    type = DerivativeParsedMaterial
    property_name = f_loc
    coupled_variables = c
    expression = '6*27000*(1/3*(c*log(c)+(1-c)*log(1-c))+c*(1-c))'
    derivative_order = 2
  [../]
[]

[Postprocessors]
  [./step_size]             # Size of the time step
    type = TimestepSize
  [../]
  [./iterations]            # Number of iterations needed to converge timestep
    type = NumNonlinearIterations
  [../]
  [./nodes]                 # Number of nodes in mesh
    type = NumNodes
  [../]
  [./evaluations]           # Cumulative residual calculations for simulation
    type = NumResidualEvaluations
  [../]
  [./active_time]           # Time computer spent on simulation
    type = PerfGraphData
    section_name = "Root"
    data_type = total
  [../]
[]

[Preconditioning]
  [./coupled]
    type = SMP
    full = true
  [../]
[]

[Executioner]
  type = Transient
  solve_type = NEWTON
  l_max_its = 30
  l_tol = 1e-9
  nl_max_its = 50
  nl_abs_tol = 1e-9
  dtmin = 1e-15
  end_time = 1   # 7 days
  petsc_options_iname = '-pc_type -ksp_gmres_restart -sub_ksp_type
                         -sub_pc_type -pc_asm_overlap'
  petsc_options_value = 'asm      31                  preonly
                         ilu          1'
  [./TimeStepper]
    type = IterationAdaptiveDT
    dt = 1e-12
    cutback_factor = 0.8
    growth_factor = 1.5
    optimal_iterations = 7
  [../]
  [./Adaptivity]
    coarsen_fraction = 0.1
    refine_fraction = 0.7
    max_h_level = 4
    cycles_per_step = 2
  [../]
[]

[Debug]
  show_var_residual_norms = true
[]

[Outputs]
  exodus = true
  csv = true
  [out]
    type = Checkpoint
    interval = 3
    num_files = 2
  []
[]

The  mpiexec... command works from within a node.  Running the code for a while and then trying again to run from sbatch with --restore gives the same error, so it doesn't seem to be an issue with creating .e, .csv or checkpoint files/folder.
Running sbatch with 'which python' and 'mamba list' give the expected outputs.
Removing checkpointing from output (with a new file/filename) does not fix the problem.  It seems it can't parse the .i file when launched through sbatch to find the output block?  Weird.

Can you try simplifying a bit? Just do a syntax check without MPI:
#!/bin/bash
#SBATCH --job-name=MOOSE1
#SBATCH --account=elbert
#SBATCH --partition=compute-hugemem
#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=40
#SBATCH --mem=700G
#SBATCH --time=00:05:00 # Max runtime in DD-HH:MM:SS format.
#SBATCH --chdir=/gscratch/elbert/projects/cahn_hilliard2
#SBATCH --export=ALL

source ~/.bashrc
mamba activate moose
./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i --check-input

/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/python
Setting Up
  Finished Uniformly Refining                                                            [^[[33m  1.42 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  204 MB^[[39m]
^[[36mThe following total 2 aux variables:
  M
  dM/dc
are added for automatic output by MaterialOutputAction.^[[39m
  Initializing
    Finished Initializing Equation Systems                                               [^[[33m  3.23 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  566 MB^[[39m]
  Finished Initializing                                                                  [^[[33m  3.69 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  566 MB^[[39m]
Finished Setting Up                                                                      [^[[33m  5.47 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  566 MB^[[39m]
Syntax OK

With MPI (mpiexec -np 38 ./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i --check-input):
/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/python


*** ERROR ***
"add_output" is not a registered task.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0

I'm going to assume that you get the same with two processes as well.
Does which mpirun give you the one from within the mamba environment?

source ~/.bashrc
mamba activate moose
which python
which mpicc
which gcc
#./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i --check-input
mpiexec -np 38 ./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i --check-input

/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/python
/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/mpicc
/usr/bin/gcc


*** ERROR ***
"add_output" is not a registered task.

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 0

source ~/.bashrc
mamba activate moose
which python
which mpicc
which mpirun
which gcc
#./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i --check-input
mpiexec -np 2 ./cahn_hilliard2-opt -i s4_mobility_cross_KM5.i --check-input

/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/python
/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/mpicc
/mmfs1/gscratch/elbert/python/mambaforge3/envs/moose/bin/mpirun
/usr/bin/gcc
Setting Up
  Uniformly Refining                                                                     [^[[33m  6.37 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  225 MB^[[39m]
^[[36mThe following total 2 aux variables:
  M
  dM/dc
are added for automatic output by MaterialOutputAction.^[[39m
  Initializing
    Initializing Equation Systems.                                                       [^[[33m 11.16 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  416 MB^[[39m]
  Finished Initializing                                                                  [^[[33m 12.51 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  416 MB^[[39m]
Finished Setting Up                                                                      [^[[33m 21.44 s^[[39m] [^[[33m  416 MB^[[39m]
Syntax OK
Syntax OK
2 processes okay, 8 processes okay, 18 or 38 processes not okay.
10 and 14 processes okay, 16 processes not okay
And the simulation is running fine with 14 processes.  Interestingly, the number of local nodes is 19033, so close to optimal for this problem.
I take it back, it is running, but about 100 times slower than just running mpiexec from a node with 14 processes.

Oops, should be #SBATCH --cpus-per-task=40, not #SBATCH --ntasks-per-node=40
Works now.

node.title: adGradSln and adGradSlnNeighbor
node.bodyText:
Hi. I need to evaluate gradients of two variables on element faces in an FV interface kernel code. AFAIK, var1().adSlnGrad(*_face_info,determineState()) will evaluate the gradient of var1 on the element face, but I am a little hazy on how to evaluate var2 on the same face when var2 lives in an element on the other side of the face. I have tried var2().adGradSln(_face_info->neighborPtr(),determineState()) but I am not sure this is correct (problems converging). There is also adGradSlnNeighbor but var2().adGradSlnNeighbor() does not work (it seems like adGradSlnNeighbor() does not want any arguments but all sorts of errors are generated by libMesh). Any comments, help, or suggestion are gratefully accepted.
Cheers,
Olle
For var2 have you tried var2().adSlnGrad(*_face_info,determineState())?

Hi Alex. Yes, now I have. It  compiles but also gives convergence problems - to be honest, the convergence problems could be due to something else and not this particular issue.
Thanks,
Olle

node.title: Unable to compile MOOSE due to PETSc error in Linux
node.bodyText:
I am trying to install MOOSE on my linux machine by following the procedure in MOOSE Framework - Getting started.. However, I am unable to compile MOOSE because of the following error:
/home/user/miniconda3/envs/moose/include/petscsys.h:211:6: error: #error "PETSc was configured with MPICH but now appears to be compiling using a non-MPICH mpi.h"
 211 | #    error "PETSc was configured with MPICH but now appears to be compiling using a non-MPICH mpi.h" |      ^~~~~
How can I deal with this error? Any suggestions would be much appreciated. Thank you.

There appears to be multiple MPI wrappers available within your PATH, and make is choosing the wrong one.
Can you tell us more about the machine you are operating on? Linux? What Distro/Flavor? Also, a report of what your environment looks like would be very helpful (these sorts of issues are almost always environment related):
env
Do you use modules? Any loaded (env above would tell us)?
module list
What does your PATH look like (env above would tell us):
echo $PATH
Cheers!

Thanks Jason!
I figured out that I needed to install mpich module, and then I was able to install MOOSE.
Thanks a lot for your help!

Hi, I found multiple MPI wrappers are available in my PATH, how could I choose the correct one.
Thank you for your help!

Please post in a new discussions thread.
We ll need to know your installation method and platform
I post a new discusion as #25047

node.title: Enabling opacity is vanishing my image on Paraview
node.bodyText: Hi, Can anyone tell why enabling opacity vanishing the image on paraview? Please see the attached image.

Hello
you probably can ask this on the paraview forum to get an answer quicker.
Guillaume

node.title: PETSc was configured with MPICH but now appears to be compiling using a non-MPICH mpi.h
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
yesterday，I used "make",  the report was "PETSc was configured with MPICH but now appears to be compiling using a non-MPICH mpi.h".
what should I do ?
Thanks for your help!

Hello
You need to be consistent between MPI distributions when building MOOSE and its dependencies. Typically this can happen if you loaded an HPC module when configuring, then loaded another when (re-)building
Or if you have both a conda-installed MPI distribution and a non-conda MPI already on your machine
Guillaume

thanks for your help!
but I don‘t how to operate it.
what is the output of the diagnostic script in moose/scripts

I got this problem too, besides another one is "no type named 'value_type' in 'struct std::iterator_traits<infix_ostream_iterator<std::basic_string > >", what shoud I do?
Thank you for your help!

Hello
please post in a new discussions thanks

node.title: error while updating mamba
node.bodyText:
Hi
I installed moose in 2022/04 and updated it first time yesterday.
after Update MOOSE repository by:
cd ~/projects/moose
git fetch origin
git rebase origin/master
I check the website https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/new_users.html and update by mamba:
mamba activate moose
mamba update --all
but the following error comes up while compiling my app:
/home/nsi/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/MathFVUtils.h:196:44: error: 'TensorTraits' is not a member of 'libMesh::TensorTools' 196 |   else if constexpr (libMesh::TensorTools::TensorTraits<T1>::rank == 1) |                                            ^~~~~~~~~~~~ /home/nsi/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/MathFVUtils.h:196:59: error: expected primary-expression before '>' token 196 |   else if constexpr (libMesh::TensorTools::TensorTraits<T1>::rank == 1) |                                                           ^ /home/nsi/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/MathFVUtils.h:196:62: error: '::rank' has not been declared; did you mean 'std::rank'? 196 |   else if constexpr (libMesh::TensorTools::TensorTraits<T1>::rank == 1) |                                                              ^~~~ |                                                              std::rank 
Then I update conda by:
conda activate moose
conda update --all
which  didn't solve the error
when I execute mamba update --all again comes the error:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/nsi/mambaforge3/bin/mamba", line 7, in <module> from mamba.mamba import main File "/home/nsi/mambaforge3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mamba/mamba.py", line 51, in <module> from mamba import repoquery as repoquery_api File "/home/nsi/mambaforge3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/mamba/repoquery.py", line 12, in <module> def _repoquery(query_type, q, pool, fmt=api.QueryFormat.JSON): AttributeError: module 'libmambapy' has no attribute 'QueryFormat' 
the error also comes when executing mamba env remove -n moose and mamba init
I am not sure whether the error has something to do with "conda update --all" or not and I don't know how to deal with the error, which makes me fail to compile my app and moose/test.
Thanks very much

Hello
if mamba update fails, this probably means the environment is borked.
Delete the moose mamba environment then re install it following the original instructions getting started with moose on Linux/mac
Guillaume

Well @harveyzhengxh is trying to delete the moose environment mamba env remove -n moose but that also causes the error. When this happens, the correct thing to do, would be to reinstall Mambaforge all together.
rm -rf /home/nsi/mambaforge3
Close any opened terminals, open them again, and follow through the installation procedures from the beginning. If the problem persists, this could mean there is something "python" related in your bash or other shell profiles sourcing "something" which interferes with Mambaforge "somehow". We can try to diagnose that, once you've reinstalled Mambaforge, and if you do get the same errors...

thanks for your answer,i solve the error by reinstall mamba first.
conda install -c conda-forge mamba
then reinstall the moose mamba environment by:
mamba env remove -n moose
mamba create -n moose moose-dev
I am capable of compiling moose and my own app now

node.title: Moose interprets all grid points with the information from the first point in the CSV
node.bodyText:
I encountered an issue when using PiecewiseConstantFromCSV and PropertyReadFile to read doping information from a CSV file. The problem is that the software seems to only read the data of the first point in the CSV file, meaning that Moose interprets all grid points with the information from the first point in the CSV.
Firstly, let me introduce the format of the CSV file that I want to read. The first two columns represent the X and Y coordinates, respectively, and the third column contains the doping information.
Secondly, let me explain how I used PiecewiseConstantFromCSV and PropertyReadFile in the input file: [Provide the relevant configuration and settings in the input file].
[UserObjects]
  [reader_node_n]
  type = PropertyReadFile
  prop_file_name = 'rec_n2_3.csv'
  read_type = 'voronoi'
  nprop = 2
  nvoronoi = 4152 # My CSV file has a total of 4152 points
  []
[]

[Functions]
  [node_n]
    type = PiecewiseConstantFromCSV
    read_prop_user_object = 'reader_node_n'
    read_type = 'voronoi'
    column_number = '2'
  []
[]

I am confused as to why such an error occurs, I would appreciate your help

I've seen issues with this object when the CSV file has windows line endings. The file is not properly parsed anymore.
You can use to clean the file:
dos2unix file_name.csv
or
sed -e 's/\r//g' file_name.csv &> file_name_clean.csv

First of all, thank you for your answer. You mean that there is a problem with my CSV file format, because moose cannot work correctly because of the end of Windows. However, after I used 'dos2unix file_name.csv' to correct my csv file, the problem still hasn't been solved, is there a problem elsewhere

Do you mind pasting a few lines from the CSV file?
Is this a 3D simulation with 2D points in the CSV file?

The sections of my csv file are as follows：
0 0 1.52E+09
1.00E-06 0 1.51E+09
1.00E-06 1.00E-06 1.64E+09
The first column is the coordinates of x, the second column is the coordinates of y, and the third column is the doping information.When I use 'PiecewiseConstantFromCSV' and PropertyReadFile 'to read, all of the dot doping is' 1.52E+09'.
2D文件
Can you use Exodus output instead to check? I d rely on that

Are '.e 'files output by
' [Outputs]
exodus = true
[]‘viewed through paraview？
Does this'Output 'need any additional modification
I can't view the data set of the csv file in '.e' through 'paraview'
I will not get an 'Exodus output' containing csv data, what do I do

You wont get a csv from exodus output, but you get a visual representation of the fields and you  can select a certain location in paraview to look at the value there.
You ll need to output to a variable, use a FunctionAux auxkernel for that

node.title: Missing the timestep output file
node.bodyText:
Hi, Could anyone explain this?
I have a question about the results. The computing of the last timestep(t = 25s) shows converge, but the output file shows just until the previous timestep (t = 24.943s). The last .e file in the folder is 24.943s, also in the paraview, the last step is 24.943.
t = 25s


t = 24.943s
What does your Outputs block look like?
Here is the code

Hello
this is because of the ‘interval =2’ parameter
it skips every other output setup. If the last one is a skip then that s why you don’t see it in the output
Guillaume
